thread.title: How to get yourself a better deal
thread.title_full: How to get yourself a better deal

author: Sophie Elsworth, Personal finance writer
title: How to get yourself a better deal
text:
It always pays to do your homework to make sure you are getting the best deal possible.
Sophie Elsworth, Personal finance writer IF you don’t ask you won’t get and that’s certainly the case when it comes to getting tradespeople to do work for you.
Always get multiple Quote: s no matter what.
I recently had the fun job of organising to ditch some old worn-out blinds and replace them with nice fresh, clean and modern ones to brighten up my home.
Entering into this unfamiliar territory of blinds shopping I didn’t have much idea of what I’d be up for so I thought it was best to practice what I preach as a personal finance writer and shop around.
And consequently if left me $600 better off.
The first store I rang up — the one I wasn’t that keen to go with but thought I’d give a try — were only too eager to give me a free measure and Quote: the following day.
Squeezing in to meet those lovely people who measure up your window frames can be annoying, but this time I was on holidays so had a little more spare time to do my research.
The first company wasn’t too bad, their measuring up and customer service seemed pretty spot on and the woman was friendly and helpful enough ... until it came to her writing out the Quote: before she left.
Once she done all the measuring up and told me the price would total $1750 she was quick to hand me a pen and get me to sign the dotted line.
Hang on a minute, I thought I’d committed to nothing more than a“free measure and Quote: ?”
I thought it was pushy customer service to say the least but I wasn’t afraid to tell her that I was due to get another Quote: the next day from a rival — the store I was always going to get a Quote: from.
Straight away she cooled down about me signing the payment form and reiterated to me she would give me a better deal if I got a more competitive price elsewhere.
Fast forward 24 hours and the next Quote: came it at an astounding $600 more for almost identical orders.
This saleswoman wasn’t as pushy about getting to me pay, but I told her I was likely to go with the first Quote: as there was such a massive price difference.
She asked if she could have a copy of my first Quote: and she’d take it to show her manager to she what she could do.
She assured me she would be back in touch that afternoon and was hopefully she could do a better price.
Sure enough a few hours later the phone rang and it was the lady from the second store — the one with the expensive Quote: — telling me she had some luck.
Not only had her boss agreed to match the price of my first Quote: he’d also knock off another $50 to make the deal $1700 square.
What a steal I thought.
Without the ability to compare Quote: s I would have had no idea if I was getting a good or bad deal.
So if you’re keen to save yourself a few dollars surely this has got to be one of the quickest ways to do it.
Always get at least two Quote: s.
sophie.elsworth@news.com.au
 How to get yourself a better deal
